data.content:
• ON24 REST API
  • ››Registration
  • ››Seamless Registration
  • ››Seamless Registration Virtual Conference

 

Seamless Registration Virtual Conference

Seamless Registration is a service for pushing registrant data to Virtual Conferences. This service supports both the GET and POST HTTP methods.

 

Registration API URL:

https://vshow.on24.com/vshow/<showCode>/register

 

Required Parameters

email User email address
password User chosen password (if applicable)
apiKey Preview password
apiMode If parameter provided, value always needs to be “Y”
target This URL parameter overrides the show lobby URL to redirect after successful registration. Only use if “apiMode” parameter is not passed or equal to “N”

 

Optional Parameters

firstName  
lastName  
company  
jobTitle  
jobFunction  
username Denotes screen name. Ideally this parameter should NOT be used, as the platform will generate a unique username based on the provided first name and last name.
addressStreet1  
addressStreet2  
city  
state  
zip  
country  
marketingEmail Y/N; Default value is “N”; Used for subscription and notfication
eventEmail Y/N; Default value is “Y”; If “N” then user will not receive reminder, attendee and no-show emails.
workPhone  
homePhone  
fax  
companyIndustry  
companySize  
other  
notes  
std1 Custom field #1
std2 Custom field #2
std3 Custom field #3
std4 Custom field #4
std5 Custom field #5
std6 Custom field #6
std7 Custom field #7
std8 Custom field #8
std9 Custom field #9
std10 Custom field #10
partnerref String value signifying a code to track client campaigns
locale

Locale/Language. To be used only if show supports multiple languages.

 

  • English = en
  • हिंदी: Hindi = hi
  • Deutsch: German = de
  • English (British) = en_UK
  • English (United States) = en_US
  • Español: Spanish = es
  • Español: Spanish (Latin America) = es_MX
  • Fijian = fj
  • Français: French = fr
  • French : Canada = fr_CA
  • Indonesia: Indonesian l=id
  • Italiano: Italian = it
  • Nederlands: Dutch = nl
  • Português: Portuguese = pt
  • Svenska: Swedish = sv_SE
  • Türkçe: Turkish l=tr
  • polski: Polish = pl
  • Русский: Russian = ru
  • עברית: Hebrew = iw
  • العربية:Arabic l=ar
  • ภาษาไทย: Thai = th
  • 中文 (简体): Chinese (Simplified) = zh_CN
  • 中文 (繁體): Chinese (Traditional) = zh_TW
  • 日本語: Japanese = ja
  • 한국어: Korean l=ko

 
timezoneCode If applicable, please click here for available time zone codes.
operatingSystem Operating system of the user through which the original registration happened. If this field is not provided then value of USER_AGENT header field would be used to deduce the operating system name.
browser Bowser used by the user at time of registration. If this field is not provided then value of USER_AGENT header field would be used to deduce the browser name.
eventUserIp IP Address of the user. If this field is not provided then value of remote host header field would be used to get the IP address.
regPageId To be used only if the show has multiple registration pages. Numeric value signifying which registration page the user’s registration should be attributed. This value is as provided by Virtual Show Manager Registration Page setup. If no value is provide, system will assume the default registration page.
rc Role code parameter. Applicable for role feature enabled shows.
updateIfExists Y/N; Default value if the parameter is not passed is assumed to be “N”. When set to “Y”, the system will update an existing user record with the data in the request if a user is found with the same unique identifier.
setting_hideProfile Y/N. Hide user’s profile to others when “Y”. If no value passed, set to show default value.
setting_notAvailableToAttendees Y/N. User not visible to other attendees when “Y”. If no value passed, set to show default value.
setting_notAvailableToShowStaff Y/N. User not visible to the Sponsor Reps when “Y”. If no value passed, set to show default value.
setting_messagesToExtEmail Y/N. User will get emails to their external email address as well asthe in-show email inbox if “Y”. If no value passed, set to show default value.
setting_dontOpenWindowOnNewMessage Y/N. Controls whether or not to open a new window when someone sends a message. If no value passed, set to show default value.

 

First Time Registrants

 

If the system receives a registration request for a user whose information is not available in the data store (new registrant), the following steps are taken:

 

  1. Register the new user with the provided information.

  2. On successful registration, send out a confirmation email.

  3. Creation an “auth” cookie which will be valid for 5 minutes. The XML response will contain the auth token value as shown below.

  4. If the registration information includes tracking information for regPageId or partnerref, store this tracking information for the newly created user.

Successful Registration Response

<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>

<response>

<status>ok</status>

<token>nON2KJA2kPb0Ixr0e0J71YWdKIm1Jmx%2FTYY6GKLVBKs%3D</token>

</response>

 

If using a server POST, then the token needs to be passed as a request paramter appended to the show URLor lobby URL using the below format.

https://vshow.on24.com/vshow/<showCode>?auth=<tokenValue>

 

Existing Users

If the system receives a registration request for a user and based on the email provided, it determines the user is already a valid registrant, the following steps are taken:

  1. If the user has already registered with the same regPageId, his/her next attempts will be ignored by the tracking system and no confirmation email will be sent.

  2. If the user has already registered but the new request contains a new regPageId, a confirmation email will be sent from the new registration page.

  3. Send a response that the user is already registered along with the auth cookie creation and the auth token value.

  4. If the registration information includes tracking information for regPageId or partnerref, store this tracking information for the newly created user.

User Already Registered

<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>

<response>

<status>USER_ALREADY_REGISTERED</status>

<token>nON2KJA2kPb0Ixr0e0J71aPpWQKiqcZmyIlLeLEKPtI%3D</token>

</response>

 

Registration Confirmation Email

A registration confirmation email is sent out for every valid registration attempt per regPageId. If a registration value already exists for a user with a given regPageId, then no confirmation email will be sent out. If the registration information does not contain regPageId parameter, the system will use the default registration page.

 

Auto Login Token Generation API

This API is used to generate the token which will login the user automatically without being asked for the credentials again. This API creates the “auth” cookie as well as returns the token in the response. This token would be valid for approximately 5 minutes.

 

API URL:

https://vshow.on24.com/vshow/<showCode>/token/generate

 

Required Parameters

email

User email; needs to be unique for the show

password

User chosen password OR apiKey (show preview password)

apiMode

Y/N (If parameter not provided, default value = N)

target

This URL parameter overrides the Lobby URL to redirect on successful registration. Required if apiMode = N.

 

Other supported parameters

 

errorUrl

escaped URL; applicable when apiMode=N; optional; redirected to errorUrl on failed login with an additional request parameter appended to errorUrl called “errorCode” Eg. errorCode=USER_NOT_REGISTERED or errorCode=INVALID_USER_PASSWORD.

 

Successful Token Generation Response

<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>

<response>

<token>nON2KJA2kPb0Ixr0e0J71aPpWQKiqcZmyIlLeLEKPtI%3D</token>

</response>

 

 

Error Messages

 

Email missing in registration information

<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>

<error>

<type>GENERAL</type>

<message>EMAIL_MISSING</message>

</error>

 

Registration not available (archive expired or registration page expired)

<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>

<error>

<type>GENERAL</type>

<message>REGISTRATION_NOT_AVAILABLE</message>

</error>

 

Invalid Domain Access (if show has white label domain and access attempt not from that domain)

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<error>

<type>VALIDATION</type>

<message>INVALID_DOMAIN_ACCESS</message>

</error>

 

Unsecured access (if show configured as a secure show and attempted access via http)

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<error>

<type>VALIDATION</type>

<message>UNSECURED_ACCESS</message>

</error>

 

Unauthorized IP

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<error>

<type>VALIDATION</type>

<message>UNAUTHORIZED_IP</message>

</error>

 

Unauthorized Referrer

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<error>

<type>VALIDATION</type>

<message>UNAUTHORIZED_REFERER</message>

</error>

 

Unauthorized Reg Email (User registers with email domain which is blocked for the show)

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<error>

<type>VALIDATION</type>

<message>UNAUTHORIZED_REG_EMAIL</message>

</error>

 

User Email who is not registered for this show.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<error>

<type>VALIDATION</type>

<message>USER_NOT_REGISTERED</message>

</error>

 

Invalid Password Provided

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<error>

<type>VALIDATION</type>

<message>INVALID_USER_PASSWORD</message>

</error>

 

Invalid API Key

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<error>

<type>VALIDATION</type>

<message>INVALID_API_KEY</message>

</error>

 

Invalid password and Invalid API key provided

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<error>

<type>VALIDATION</type>

<message>VALID_API_KEY_OR_PASSWORD_REQUIRED</message>

</error>

ON24 patents may apply – click here for more information.
All rights reserved.
